nodes.bodyText:
please make comment //indent:4 exp:8 warn
all lines with violation should have warn comment, event it is not yet enforced.
we did not make it enforced to keep comment aligned with actual violation.
It is enforced in it folder, but not in test folder. It is one of future GSoC projects to make our UTs be more behavior focused and comments in Input actually define expected violation.

nodes.bodyText:
Corrected!, actually the checkConfig here is only Indentation, and I thought it is following the default indentation profile, and I checked it against cli on terminal and everything was fine.
But later on further debugging, founded that it was just another config with different properties and indentation attributes.
Checked it only cli, and got the same result, then further found  that the problem was caused be chained method calls where the new is not the direct child of assign which was not covered in the current code logic.
Now Corrected!

nodes.bodyText:
Yes, but earlier it was explictly coded like that to follow the current indent of parent, and then lineWrpping also (multi-indents) so left that logic.
In some cases it is good for code readability too, to indent new keyword just down its parent.
Though I could change the logic to strictly follow only lineWrapping.

nodes.bodyText: is it because they have their own handlers ?

So if everything is covered inside the handler, then no need to explicitly check it against the lineWrappingHandler.

please help to remove this word from message in scope of #9113
it will simplify regression report review.
You can place update for message in this PR as separate commit so it will be easy to regenerate report.
Unfortunately Indentation Check is so complicated and so many variations of code could be so we rely of diff report too much, as  our test have only very basic set of inputs.
Current diff report is unmanageable, too much changes.

nodes.bodyText:
isForceStrictCond is a bad name for a variable. Why not isForceStrictCondition or forceStrictCondition?
If a line does not fit, you can add overload to isAcceptable method. Something like IndentLevel.isAcceptable(int indent, boolean isForceStrictCondition). Then it will add a bit of readability.
